title: Mauricio Pochettino relishing chance to give White Hart Lane fairytale ending with Premier League title
text:
Sport Mauricio Pochettino relishing chance to give White Hart Lane fairytale ending with Premier League title The Spurs boss can feel a momentum building as his side enter their final months at the Lane Share Spurs are in their final season at White Hart Lane (Photo: Dan Mullan) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
For Tottenham fans, just winning the title is the stuff of fantasy. 
Clinching it as they bring the curtain down on their stay at White Hart Lane would surely create memories that could never be surpassed. 
Yet Mauricio Pochettino can feel a momentum building. 
Just as the final season at Upton Park saw West Ham launch an unlikely challenge for the top four, Spurs are beginning to look like the biggest rivals to Chelsea. 
Victory over Manchester City tonight would pull the north Londoners even further away from the club that used to kick sand in their faces. It would also keep the dream alive of a fairytale finish to a special campaign. Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino admits £9,500 'tunnel tickets' at Spurs' new ground could be "dangerous" 
“It would be amazing.” said Pochettino. “The most important thing in Tottenham’s history because this season we can feel in every game how excited are to spend time at White Hart Lane. 
“You can imagine how tough it will be in a few months when it doesn’t exist, White Hart Lane, and we need to move to play at Wembley. It will be very tough for our fans and for the people who love Tottenham. 
“I think it is an energy or an extra that we feel, the players feel, in the way that we are playing this season at White Hart Lane. 
“You can see that we are warriors. You defend your home, your house, and that is the what the fans see too – how the players love to fight in every game and it’s the connection and the energy and the feeling that we have got in every game at White Hart Lane is amazing.” Pochettino's men have found their form (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
After a nightmare spell during which the club crashed out of the Champions League and managed to win just one of ten games in all competitions, Spurs are on the way back up. 
Including their FA Cup third round win over Aston Villa, they have now won nine of their last ten with their last seven coming on the bounce. 
Striker Harry Kane hit a hat-trick in the 4-0 win over West Brom last weekend while Dele Alli has netted seven times in his last six. 
The Spurs defence remains the strongest in the Premier League so far. View gallery 
But Pochettino - who celebrated four years in English football this week - admits his rising stars still need to win something to start realising their potential. He said: “We are very young. The squad is very young. I am very young still. 
“It is true that four years ago I was younger but, you know, I am here to try and help the club achieve big things. 
“Today we are in a process that, when you built a stadium, always it’s difficult. But we have unbelievable players, a unbelievable squad. Players that feel Tottenham. 
“They need big patience. But it’s true that our objective is to win titles and to put the club on the level that it deserves.” Guardiola and his Manchester City side are next up (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Transfer news LIVE: All the latest from the January window 
Pep Guardiola suffered his heaviest-ever league defeat as a manager when his side were slaughtered 4-0 at Everton last Sunday. 
Yet for all the criticism that the Spaniard has received, he is still on a run of five wins from his last seven, including the FA Cup. 
Pochettino went on: “To me it means nothing for City to lose against Everton. It does not change my admiration or what are my thoughts about him. 
“He needs time, he’s in a position where they can still win titles. He has shown enough quality before in Barcelona and in Bayern Munich. The important thing is that you cannot win after a few months titles. You need to wait until the end - and you can be sure that Guardiola will fight with Manchester City until the end for big things.” poll loading What's your prediction for this one? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
